name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On November 9, a blogger summarized the six sins of the night bikers in Zhengzhou, Henan: wasting taxpayers’ money, blocking public transportation, affecting the lives of citizens, blindly following the trend and collective anti-intellectualism, the organizers ignoring safety, and littering.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On November 8, veterans from Zhengzhou also joined the night riding team to Kaifeng

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On November 8, some college students hid shared bicycles in their dormitories in advance for night riding, causing people who needed to use the bicycles to be unable to find them even though there were bicycles located on their location.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Some bloggers are opposed to students riding bicycles: students may feel comfortable riding bicycles, but they leave a mess for the local government to clean up, and also cause trouble and inconvenience to local citizens.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On November 9, in Kaifeng, Henan, students rode to Kaifeng and abandoned their bikes on the roadside, leaving a large number of bikes piled up in the middle of the road, causing citizens to be delayed in their travel and work.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On November 10, there were police on duty at every intersection in Zhengzhou, Henan. Students who were unable to ride bicycles waved national flags and chose to run to Kaifeng.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: November 9, Zhengzhou, Henan. Due to the large number of people riding at night, bicycles were in short supply, so some students hid their bicycles in their dormitories in advance, with the idea that if they didn't ride, you wouldn't be able to ride either.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On November 9, a netizen complained that because of the night riding incident, she was forced to return to school immediately after returning to her home in another city, and she had to take the high-speed train back to school overnight. At the same time, she complained in the comment area: Can those who didn’t ride be guaranteed to be admitted to graduate school? Another netizen echoed: Can those who don’t ride pass the teaching qualification?

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On November 9, the college students arrived in Kaifeng after a night ride and fell asleep everywhere.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Some netizens have discovered that shared bikes on Zhengkai Avenue may be locked automatically in the past few days. Even if you pay a high out-of-area dispatch fee, there is still a possibility that they will be locked randomly. This has caused many college students to be trapped in the middle of the night in the middle of nowhere and have to leave on foot.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On November 8, Zhengzhou High-Speed Railway Station was filled with college students from all over the country.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On October 24, at the Chengdu No. 7 High School Hi-Tech Campus, students protested because the school postponed the school sports meeting on a sunny day due to "weather reasons". Students wore hats and held umbrellas to exercise during the break, and some even took off their coats and covered their heads. Everyone pretended to flee in a hurry because of the heavy rain. Some students also placed umbrellas in front of the teaching building for everyone to take.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On November 7, in Pingjiang County, Hunan Province, a farmer reported in her real name that the local town government and the developer had cheated her, built a house in her name, expanded the floor area beyond the limit, occupied the land, and prevented her from moving in. Over the past decade, she has repeatedly reported the problem to relevant departments at all levels of government, but the problem has never been resolved.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: November 5 (Release), Jinzhou, Liaoning. Chang Shouhai, a veteran of the Central Guard Corps, reported the Liaoning Beizhen People's Court for its inaction.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: A large number of taxi drivers in Nanchong went on strike and stopped operating. November 7, Nanchong, Sichuan. It was reported online that taxi drivers in Jialing District, Nanchong City went on strike and stopped operating because the fees were too high and they were not making money. A taxi driver said: "Taxis pay too much money every month. They have to pay 6,225 yuan in rent a month, which is 215 yuan per day. Now taxis have no business and can't make money at all. They can only make 300 yuan by driving until four or five o'clock in the evening every day." The driver also said, "We have two demands, one is to reduce fees, and the other is to buy insurance. The company does not buy all the insurance for drivers, such as accident insurance."

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On November 9, a blogger shared a notice from a university in Henan Province, saying that the Henan Provincial Government has clearly required students not to ride in Kaifeng. At the same time, the entire school will be closed for one month, and in principle no leave will be allowed. If you want to take leave, it needs the judgment of the leaders.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Ironically, on November 16, two years ago, Zhengzhou University was the first school in China to experience a large-scale protest against the anti-clearance and school closure. (So when the White Paper Movement occurred ten days later, the students of Zhengzhou University had basically left the school and went home)
And today, two years later, the students of Zhengzhou University were locked in the school again because of riding shared bicycles.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On November 9 (released), migrant workers in Sunac Tangzhen, Pudong New Area, Shanghai, were struggling to get their wages.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: In the early morning of the 10th, some college students chose to walk because non-motor vehicles were prohibited from entering Zhengkai Avenue.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: https://t.co/AiRa32esEo

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On November 8, students rode at night in Zhengzhou, Henan.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: November 8, Zhengzhou, Henan.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
November 8, Zhengzhou, Henan.
Video 1: Students riding at night and passers-by shout: Down with Japanese imperialism!
Video 2: Students riding at night shout: Long live the Chinese nation! Long live the People's Republic of China!

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: November 9, Kaifeng, Henan. Police formed a human wall to control the flow of people

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On November 9, Kaifeng, Henan. After riding to Kaifeng at night, students from Zhengzhou lay on the ground exhausted. Before leaving, they left the garbage and shared bicycles along the way to the people of Kaifeng.
